intro: Cynanchica sintenisii, commonly known as the Sintenis' milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, characterized by its typical legume structure and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features trifoliate leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. Its fruit is a legume pod containing several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its adaptation to harsh environments, it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
